meanings.definition: A person or thing that winks.
meanings.sent1: The little girl was known as the class winker because she blinked often.
meanings.sent2: The winker in the movie always made funny faces when joking around.
meanings.sent3: The winker at the party kept making silly faces to entertain everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her pet dog became the winker of the family, always blinking at them playfully.
meanings.sent5: The winker in the play had a mischievous glint in his eye, making the audience laugh.

meanings.definition: A turn signal on a vehicle.
meanings.sent1: Remember to use your winker before changing lanes to indicate your direction.
meanings.sent2: The driver forgot to turn off the winker after making a left turn.
meanings.sent3: The winker on the car blinked rapidly, confusing the drivers behind.
meanings.sent4: Her old car's winker was like a faithful friend, always signaling the way.
meanings.sent5: The bright winker on the truck caught the attention of the pedestrians, guiding them safely.

meanings.definition: A small hole or slit for light or air.
meanings.sent1: The room had a tiny winker near the ceiling to let in some sunlight.
meanings.sent2: He opened the winker in the attic to allow fresh air to circulate.
meanings.sent3: The old house had a mysterious winker that let in moonlight at night.
meanings.sent4: The winker in the door was like a secret peephole, revealing a glimpse of the outside world.
meanings.sent5: She discovered a hidden winker in the wall, bringing a beam of sunshine into the dark room.
